intro: Stilaginella, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small herbs with simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. They are often found in rocky or coastal habitats, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Stilaginella species are characterized by their capsule fruits that release small, wind-dispersed seeds. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in horticulture for their ornamental value.
